item.title: gogitignore
item.description: The other day I extended one of my go (golang) project with some new main packages resulting in new commands. After building the project with go build the resulting executables are placed in the respective directories within the project. While updating the git repository I found it cumbersome to add all the new executables to the .gitignore-file. On linux there is unfortunately now easy way to exclude all executables within a project with a single line in .gitignore.
